Title: ICT Service Design Review
Description:
Review ICT Service Delivery and produce a strategic improvement plan.\r
\r
The scope of work includes a requirement to undertake an initial review and assessment of the current IT architecture, existing service capacity and capabilities that are currently in place, and then provide recommendations on a future strategy for the service based on the findings.\r
The work shall be carried out in three phases:\r
\r
1. Discovery\r
1a. Architecture\r
1b. Project & commercial\r
2. Business capability mapping\r
3. Review and report creation

Title: NHS Business Services Authority IT Infrastructure Sourcing - Managed Infrastructure Services
Description:
The Authority's contract with its incumbent supplier for ICT managed services is due to expire on 31 December 2019.  The incumbent supplier provides all ICT managed services on an aggregated basis.  In this re-procurement of services the Authority is following a disaggregated model.  The new overarching target operating model ("TOM"), of which this contract for managed infrastructure services forms a part, is designed to enhance internal systems and service integration capabilities by replacing the single supplier ICT managed services with services provided by a  mix of in-house and external suppliers.

This contract award notice relates to a contract for the design, implementation and maintenance of the centralised and distributed platforms and infrastructure services needed to support the Authority's in-scope business applications.  The centralised platforms and infrastructure services for these will be designed and built within the data centres by the managed infrastructure supplier; followed by a cutover of data and applications from the incumbent data centres.  Infrastructure services hosted on the Authority's sites will be transitioned to the new supplier via a 'walk in, takeover' approach.  This service will also include cloud brokerage where applications are able to be cloud hosted and so reduce the footprint of the residual "on-premise" data centre estate.

The contract is in the form of a tailored version of the Crown Commercial Service's Model services Agreement.  The TOM involves a move away from dependency on a single prime supplier to a multi-supplier environment with suppliers being onboarded, offboarded and managed by the Authority under service integration and management function arrangements.  Collaboration and cooperation across the supplier base is critical to the success of the TOM in that end-to-end service delivery can only be achieved where the key suppliers are working together collaboratively.  Each supplier's ability to perform the services and meet service levels is in part dependent on one or more of the other suppliers and this has been recognised in the contract with the inclusion of collaboration principles, seeking to enable a coordinated approach to ensure the seamless, continuous, effective, timely and proper delivery of services.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Contact Address 1: Stella House, Goldcrest Way, Newburn Riverside Business Park
Additional Text:
The initial term of the contract is 4 years.  There is the option to extend for two further 12-month periods.

A contract award notice was submitted, using the eNotices portal for European public procurement, on 4 October 2018.

Title: ARFQ - Insourcing Project Manager
Description:
Sefton Council currently outsources a number of key services under a 10 year agreement which commenced in October 2008.  These services are:

•	ICT
•	Revenues & Benefits
•	Customer Services
•	Transactional HR & Payroll; and
•	Accounts Payable

The contract is due to conclude in September 2018, and Sefton Council with their outsourced partner has commenced a programme of work relating to an agreed Exit Plan.  

As part of this programme, Sefton Council are advertising for an experienced Insourcing Project Manager. This post is required to ensure the orderly transition of services from the Service Provider to the Council and /or any replacement Service Provider for ICT by 1st October 2018.

Title: Consultancy Support re: An assessment of the effectiveness of the current Information & Technology service, and of future strategic direction and supporting plans
Description:
The scope of the review will cover a number of areas as follows:-

•	Information & Technology Strategy - whether fit for purpose in setting direction for the medium term.
•	Current capacity for strategic planning, horizon scanning, bringing ideas and innovation into the Council.
•	Assessment of emerging transition/improvement plan.
•	Assessment of strategic and technical roadmaps and general direction of travel e.g. simplification, use of cloud.
•	Current structures - including leadership and management capacity and capability.
•	Effectiveness of new Target Operating Model, and synergies between all parts of the service.
•	Assessment of current and future budget provision, set against size of organisation and agenda, current & desired state.
•	Balance between in-house resources and those that are externally commissioned or provided via contractors.
•	Positioning of function i.e. business led v ICT led decisions.
•	Possible future models of delivery.
•	Comparison of LCC I & T service against other organisations of a similar size and industry best practice
Documentation will be provided to the appointed consultant (structure charts, I&T Strategy, budget information, restructure documents, target operating model, roadmaps, other technical documents as necessary) in order that the time can be spent on discussions and analysis rather than data collection.  Consultants should therefore share at proposal stage the assumptions made regarding information required at project commencement.

The client for the work will be a small panel comprising:-
•	Director of Corporate Resources
•	Assistant Director (Corporate Services)
•	Head of Information & Technology

Title: ARFQ - To provide Sefton Council with Additional Resource for the Development of a New Target Operating Model for Key Council Services
Description:
Sefton Council currently outsources a number of key services under a 10 year agreement which commenced in October 2008. These services are:

•	ICT
•	Revenue & Benefits
•	Customer Services
•	Transactional HR & Payroll; and
•	Accounts Payable

This agreement is due to end in September 2018, and Sefton Council has commenced a programme of work to determine the specification that supports the optimum delivery model for the services after that date, and that reflects the business requirements of the Council & the Resource envelope available.

As part of this programme, Sefton Council is seeking external expertise to help develop these business requirements and identify the optimum target operating model for the abovementioned key Council services.
